QQHh8BqSqdRzj5Q9BqVLeA.text: This is the perfect place to go if you want a treat, it's not cheap but it's great food in a gorgeous place and service is good. For breakfast you can either turn up and sit at the front, or you can book the back area of the restaurant which I would recommend - it's more spacious and calmer. They do everything from cooked english to pancakes and maple syrup, eggs benedict, fruit salad and crumpets with nutella. With Portobello Road market right outside it's a great place to go for brunch on the weekend before you check out the market and surrounding area of Notting Hill and Westbourne Grove.

cA1-MqjE_vNNLm4KwE21Vg.text: Poor service which only improved when the rude, surly, waiter with attitude went off duty. Food was good, but not better than a lot of other London restaurants. Overrated, pretentious restaurant which needs to employ people who enjoy waiting tables and not wishing they were doing something in their minds 'better'. Will be passing on my thoughts to others as much as possible.

7G7Mt7_MA0myjUIwOyzS9A.text: Good ambiance but unfortunately, it has gone downhill. Seating in the back is cramped and food is not as good as it once was. Pancakes were almost inedible on our last visit. Bloody marys still top notch. This is a place where I have fond memories, but would not bring guests there again. Go to Automat in Mayfair for a similar vibe with much better food and more attentive staff.

v5c8SifWlc2qEsWyGCVrUA.text: really great place for brunch in notting hill. does veggie breakfast, eggs florentine, pancakes etc etc. book!

aQFDR4KI1tRL5dkbQD4zGg.text: very good burger. ask it to be rear so you have it medium. great anyway/

ZuHpexH7DF_bKMYwDfDYiA.text: Great food, music and atmosphere. Our waiter was fantastic as well. I recommend the Burger and honey fried chicken.

QX7y60kftVpMwqb736RSWQ.text: Honestly, my impression of the name made me think that this was goin to be some wanna be cool diner, but I was very pleased with the food, atmosphere and service.  I came in with a few coworkers for a late brunch on a Saturdya to escape the craziness of Portobello Market. (awesome but CRAZY).We came in and were seated immediately.  Ordered a few drinks which came very quickly.  We ordered:Quinoa and avo salad (surprisingly yummy and awesome).  This is a great dish to have for a light lunch.Avocado with chili toast and poached egg : Wowser, the avo was so fresh and juicy. I loved it, and the perfectly poached egg and chili was a great complement.Two of my friends got the cheeseburger, which apparently was outstanding and the hot dog, which was less exciting.  It was awesome, we had a kid with us and they actually totally catered to him.  We were in a rush and wanted to take his ice cream to go and they went out of their way to find a to - go cup for him. Great place!!

qhj7xNlhP7i1cnFJcRj8kw.text: Um, completely blew my mind. Came here for brunch with a few Friends and none of us really looked into the place, so we were a little more than pleasantly surprised to find such a great brunch place!As soon as we walked in the place was buzzing. There was a small seating area outside and lots of booths and a bar inside. We were seated immediately and It was refreshing not having to queue at  this popular 'no reservation' dinner.I'm going to plagiarise a popular tip that I read which went something like "you should really punch your self in the face if you don't order the Bloody Mary here'. By far the best Bloody Mary that I have ever had! And trust me, I've had a few :) The menu was delicious, we were all spoilt for choice. They've got some great veggie friendly options like the avocado on toast and quinoa with spinach. I'd definitely like to come back and try their burger too.The service was amazing- I particularly liked that our waiter slipped in and took a seat at our booth while helping us pick our order. Too intimate? Naaah! The only downside is that its a bit of a trek to get to as its quite far away from the tube- but it is completely worth it! Loved, loved, loved!

c1bXkBZmqHEL93ESXhMvcg.text: I've been here a few times already, for brunch and lunch. The english breakfast is to die for, especially the sausage and the bacon.They serve it with sourdough bread, very tasty. They have green juices and all of that as well. I tried the egg + salmon combo once and the egg tasted rather weird. My friend, being able to see the kitchen, pointed out that they weren't cooking actual eggs but rather some red liquid... I found that weird? It's good but no eggs for me anymore, and it is a little pricey (£30+ for two people for brunch). Almost forgot! Great bloody Mary's  And sweet potato fries! But again, noisy inside, weird egg thing and high prices award this place 3 stars

Tdhd6GyJLARCO1AbleMzLg.text: I've  been meaning to go to this place for a while and so finally arranged brunch here with a Yelp friend! Came on a Sunday... didn't have reservations, so had to wait a little over half an hour, but thankfully we got some seats outside where we could wait. Got seated at the bar. Now, if you're always cold, GOOD, this is the place for you. With the fires all on and the heat of the kitchen, you could feel it all. If you're not always cold... well, it can get you a little flustered. It was quite hot there, I was afraid my glass of water would soon start boiling. I got the huevos rancheros and my friend got the eggs benedict. Now let me caveat this by saying I lived in Texas for 9 years, so my standard for huevos rancheros are pretty high. They were good... but the dish was missing rice and didn't have much sauce. Quite yummy overall, but didn't fill me up either. I actually got food envy looking at my friend's 2 eggs benedict (which were also yummy). Since I hadn't quite filled up on the eggs, got 2 scoops of ice cream for dessert -- chocolate and honeycomb, which were GREAT!

dkfff2LOW634Lh9OGPlIYg.text: This place was awesome! Great food and very inexpensive. Atmosphere was cool and trendy. I had the crab soup and steak tartar which to my surprise were very good, even in London Standards! Located in Portobello Market so take a stroll and end up here for lunch!

wMO6jYDEh--np6QFyeStcQ.text: I never had a chance to try the old Electric Brasserie, but I have a feeling the new Electric diner is much better!Since the Electric re-opened, this place has been buzzing.  Every time I come here, it is packed full.  One great thing is that you can put your name and mobile down, and the hostess will call you when your table is ready.  There are no shortage of bars around the area to grab a quick drink while waiting for your table (try Montgomery!).The menu changes, but the general gist is "gourmet" American diner food.  I came here with a friend, and we had the Bone Marrow and beef cheek marmalade, flat-iron chicken (grilled to juicy perfection), crispy fries with mornay sauce and egg, and a side of roasted broccoli.  The bone marrow is really delicious, but I suggest you eat it as a sharing dish as it is extremely rich.  The roasted broccoli, although a side, was a huge hit.  Biggest "con": It is so freaking loud in there---the architect clearly did not think through the design of the space.  The ceilings are low and curved, so voices are trapped in the space.  You really have to shout to have a conversation.  Also, if you sit at the bar, the heat from the stove is almost unbearable.I am definitely coming back, and hopefully next time there will be some gourmet doughnuts left for me to try.....

ncoHhHYDgj2dLflJaREKuQ.text: There's some cool aspects to this place.  It's cozy and warm on a cold rainy night.  They serve good drinks.  The wait staff are smartly dressed and attentive.  It's aways a fun and lively place.However, there are other things that detract from the overall experience, mainly the food and food preparation.  Having the kitchen wide open to the public is both a blessing and a curse.  I always enjoy watching the chefs at work, it creates excitement and usually gives you trust in the food being prepared.  However, when the chefs are making mistakes, it cannot be hidden.First of all, when you are cooking hot dishes, like soup, over a big flame, you should not be using plastic or rubber utensils.  You certainly shouldn't be leaving them unattended in the fire-hot skillet, so they can melt into your food.  I watched this happen over and over, with the soup I had ordered.  I could even taste and smell the burnt rubber from the spatula they left in the boiling pot, touching the hot metal.Then I watched the cooks re-use the broiler oven pans over and over and over again, without washing them, so that the chicken grease was mixing with the vegetarian roasted broccoli dishes.  When it's really busy, you have to maybe cut some corners, but couldn't you at least isolate the meat dishes from the vegetarian dishes?I might be back again, because it does have a fun vibe.  But only for drinks!

TnBT40EZFgm1_2KbBuPuRg.text: I'm not sure how they define a "diner" in London, but this was definitely better than what I would expect from a diner in the US.  The menu was great and made for a hard choice.  The four of us had four different entrees and they were all very good.  The highlights were the honey fried chicken and the burger with the works (avocado, bacon and egg).  The prices were reasonable (by London standards).  I would have given it 5 stars except that the service was friendly but a bit spotty -- we had to ask a couple times for missing dishes from our order.

8dl-6jS9E0_VqJNGN_2Dxw.text: This is a very nice place for having breakfast in Portobello road. I'd recommend the eggs royale and the honey-glazed bacon. Good virgin mary, too (although it looks a bit more like a salad than like a drink at first glance..).

FICuTtqS_CO4lvDf3pTZdg.text: so, the atmosphere in here is nice.there are a million people working here, so service should be top notch. for food it was very quick (& it was fun to watch it being cooked right in front of you), but for drinks and the bill, it was pretty slow. the food itself was good - i had the open faced spinach and blue cheese fondue, which was...a cheese fondue. but a tasty one. my boyfriend had the cheese burger. i also ordered a side of broccoli and he had fries. they cost £5 each. that hurt me. far too expensive.i probably won't be back here, unless it's for a drink only. their wine menu was pretty good, and the cocktails they were serving looked interesting.

1ucjGKE94SjcTHaZP02IQg.text: Best breakfast we've had in London yet.  The menu and the food is more American style which makes sense since the concept comes from a successful French-diner in Chicago, IL.  And if the smells don't wake you up, the buzz of the staff certainly will - a true, fast-paced diner, so if you go for that sort of thing, this is it!  I've been three times thus far and my eggs have been perfect every one.  Their toast is delicious - probably because they do it on the grill-top.  And their juices are all freshly made, the apple juice is terrific.  I can't wait to try the waffles one of these visits!  Huge fan!

7fdscugHayJeFSK4662_qw.text: Time for an update:Following a fire The Electric Brasserie had to close down and re-opened in December last year under a new name: The Electric Diner does exactly what it does on the tin  it not only looks quite American, the cocktails, food and service are to match. Particularly impressed with our water glasses being refilled regularly.So my 5 stars are to stay, and I hope so is this Portobello institution.I went for pre-Christmas drinks last year and was very happy to return for a meal tonight. My friend and I both opted for chicken dishes, both delicious. Mind you, mine should have come with a warning that they expect you to eat the honey-fried chicken with your fingers. I managed to tackle the pile of sticky chicken pieces with cutlery  probably a good thing as it was so delicious I would have devoured it far too quickly otherwise. Hashbrowns and roasted broccoli were excellent side dishes.To have a pudding after all this food was pure greed; the lemon meringue pie that arrived was American super-size, but  guess what  so delicious I finished most of it, too. Luckily the espresso is nice and strong! Apart from the area's best and most exciting cinema, The Electric also comprises a private members club and an excellent bar/restaurant.Having popped in for breakfasts and snacks so many times, I had almost forgotten just how excellent a place for dinner The Electric is.Following the previous night's disappointment at Tibits, last night's dinner at The Electric made up and left a good impression of British cuisine on my friends.We had a lovely, attentive waiter and chose a selection of lovely foods. I shared some excellent merquez with yoghurt/mint dip and had the most delicious chicken & leek pie. So much succulent meat and seasoned with tarragon, my favourite herb.Everything else looked great  happy faces and round bellies all round. Really glad to see a place this popular for people watching also really delivering on the food.

AL_4rg3Vge3KdIpqGk2vnw.text: My boyfriend and I went here on Friday night to review it for my website. We sat outside (only had to wait 15 minutes which was amazing considering how fantastic the weather was!) and enjoyed the most delicious food, fantastic service and brilliant people watching! The food was pretty good value considering the area. We have tasty seasonal food and the portions were generous - which again is not something you'd necessarily expect in Notting Hill. I can't stress enough how great the service was. It really transformed our meal from a good meal to a great meal! Thank you to all the staff at the Electric for a fantastic evening.

Ff7Kx8xrdPQ1-cxMdV4TXw.text: Great diner food. Waffles and bacon were delicious. Avocado on toast was missing something but still a generous portion of avocado with a perfectly cooked egg.

ro2K8LwsIqze0XQ8xLZWEQ.text: The brasserie isn't itself a private club, not that you can tell from the attitude of some of the staff, though the 'House' upstairs is. An intermittently appealing spot for mid-week coffee and brunch, it's a 'destination' for the wrong reasons on market days.The venue is looking a little tatty around the edges now. Battered zinc tables and dark wood stretch down the side of a long open bar and kitchen, opening up into a wider dining space at the back like a calm pool behind the frenetic waterfall. We were booked into the front though 'bumped' to the backroom following a whispered argument about a 20 minute wait from the party queuing in front of us. On a weekday this would be annoying, out of sight is out of mind to the whirling wait staff. On a Saturday, the chaos front of house means a back table is preferable. A snake of expectant hipsters rubberneck at your plates as they wait at the front desk, always in the way of the dfsgrgaergasergsaergThe brunch menu is full of solid fare; full English and Vegetarian breakfasts with varying combinations, muffins, bacon and eggs in numerous combinations. As well as the obvious dishes, there are a fair few favourites from the full menu including fish or steak and chips and their passable fish pie. Avocado and poached egg on granary toast is a game choice, more avocado than anything else, but a relatively healthy way to cure a hangover. The Eggs Royale were a little disappointing despite their initial visual promise. Beautiful golden yolked eggs served atop a mountain of salmon with hollandaise sauce coating and dripping onto the muffin below. The ingredients were faultless, but with one egg virtually hard boiled and the other's unset albumen having barely been cooked, it was clear that the eye for detail wasn't covering all of the dishes to leave the kitchen.It's tough to damn somewhere for one undercooked egg, and I'm not going to. I've had some wonderfully relaxing breakfasts sat at the front of the Brasserie and a couple of reasonable lunches too, I'd just recommend avoiding it at the weekend and leave it to the tourists. If you are in the area on a weekend, it's well worth a wander down to the unfashionable end of the market to the lower reaches of Golbourne Road to the street food stalls and the wonderful pastries at the Lisboa Patisserie. It's one of several tiny Portuguese bakeries and cafes along the road and (relatively) untouched by the encroaching gentrification. Their pastel de nata are small egg custard gems, well worth the trip for a half dozen to take away and a much tastier egg than you'll find elsewhere.

Br9jGoKHCw85N9Ho_kcZIw.text: I don't know about you but I loathe multiplex cinemas. There's the interminable queueing..first for your ticket..then for some synthetic, 'convenience', chemical-laden, nutrient-free so-called food that you wouldn't feed to your dog in normal circumstances. And why is it that you have to buy a bag of 400 maltesers, rather than the usual size packet? Oh and pay £6 for it? So compared to the above, a visit to the Electric Cinema, which adjoins its sister eaterie,the Electric Brasserie, is refreshing. When I visited the other night, my friend and I were able to settle down to a pretty good meal of chicken and leek pie and mash followed by melt-in-the-mouth mango sorbet. It's a pretty noisy place on a saturday night, with the din of drinkers at the bar and cacophanous open kitchen to contend with, but definitely buzzing. We got the bill and then one of the lovely managers, Mike, offered to go and pick up our tickets and escort us through the back of the brasserie directly into the cinema's auditorium. So civilisedand not a tortilla in sight.

ImxAUzs7gPUbfJA-AqU_8g.text: I would give it more stars, as the food was lovely, but I have to agree with CaribQueen on the service. We were reminded, repeatedly, throughout our meal that they'd need the table returned at precisely 2:30pm. I realize this is common practice in London (or so I hear) but it's considered very rude in the States to give an end time to your meal, unless an exception has been made for your reservation time. And to deliver it repeatedly felt very rude, when we were only five minutes off our time. Still, the mussels were very good, as was the house red wine and the salad. The atmosphere was lively and err electric, so very much enjoyed being a part of the community for a short while. Would return, during an off-peak hour

ERTswhmq2jHLKPQLN142fA.text: Downstairs Excellent food, brilliant service, great value. A cool place to hang out and meet your friends in Portobello, no membership required. The Electric Members Club Upstairs A West London institution. It doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. So you get non-flashy interiors in an understated, mildy bohemian way. The usual suspects are invariably augmented by a famous face and sometimes many very famous faces. Locals and media moguls happily mix with production wannabes eager to make some project or other work. In the meantime the food is cooked to a consistently high standard and the drinks are mixed with real panache. The service is always very good....but do check your bill. Many a Sunday morning I've been rescued by the best Bloody Mary in W11. The founder Nick Jones has always been on the button and his awareness of the changing demographic...namely the baby boomers come of age that want to hang out and do whatever while their sprogs are in tow was genius. The free Saturday morning cinema for members' kids justifies the yearly fee many times over. If you're a somebody or an anybody wanting to be a somebody, residing in West London, membership is mandatory.

igP7bb6blbqAXMb8Jclrew.text: Horrible service. Waited almost 45 minutes for a hot dog (server forgot to put in the order). Refuse to come back here. Next time I'll just buy a hotdog and a can of Heineken at a gas station.

f28eBv3DEw4I0JwJ2Yxuhg.text: I came here on New Year's Day and had a delicious breaky to cure my hangover. I loved watching the cooks in action and everything was very tasty! We had avocado toast, a full English breakfast and eggs Benedict! Yum!!

4xjF4kkuFX9_F17m4ZVI8g.text: So we arrived and it's quite a nice atmosphere. We are in high spirits as we are off to see Jason Bourne. I ordered a beer and it came completely flat, the waiter got me another one straight away. We then had another waiter who came across a little stand-offish and a smart arse towards me and my date, especially when she was ordering wine, which I didn't like. Food was nice enough, but way overpriced. When you are paying that kind of money I expect pleasant waiters.

5gy0Bg8B7HF8XXnsEEyoYg.text: I came here for a late breakfast and it was really good. I had the eggs royale with perfectly poached eggs and delicious smoked salmon. The portion sizes are not very big but perfect for breakfast. The staff were also very polite and friendly. I loved how it was both cozy and trendy but definitely not too posh. Overall, I loved the whole ambience of the place, especially sitting at the bar looking out the window on a rainy day.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Royale

WSgpN8nCsxgnnCumd7HXww.text: Being a lover of burgers the Electric Diner has been on my hit list for quite some time.A Saturday afternoon trip to Portobello market seemed like perfect opportunity to make a visit. On stopping by we were told there would be an hour wait, no problem - they took out number and promised to call as soon as the table was ready. We went off exploring the local stalls and shops.When seated we were welcomed by a very friendly waitress, to cover it off all in all she was great. I went for the cheese burger with bacon added and an oreo milkshake.Oh lordy lord....the milkshake was tremendous. Lots of oreo chunks and a good consistency. tasty!The burger was a double patty both very thin, layered with cheese and pickles. YUM! while not a big rare burger this was meaty and tasty and made for a great lunch!A visit here is highly JD Recommended!

mwq_g5r0rs74PHFBLEPm-w.text: Wow wow wow wow wow.That was a summary of my experience at the Electric Diner. We came for a late lunch and if I had more time in England I would definitely go back for brunch as it seems to be the most popular way to go here.Atmosphere is really good, a bit closer to a real diner than that chain of Diners you find around London. Of course it doesn't quite get to the charm of a real diner (I keep saying real diner, I mean the diners in New Jersey, Land of the Diners - more like greasy spoons than fun hipster spots). But a really cool place to come into from a cold winters day. Also the booths are really comfy.I took the plunge with their bone marrow and beef cheek jam. I wanted to go safe with a burger or something but it just kept calling to me. And oh wow was it good! Tip: The menu just says 'bone marrow and beef cheek jam' without any sides so you might assume that's what you get and order a side of their mash. Unless you're starving, refrain - it comes with LOADS of well made toast!My dining partner got the chicken and squash salad and it looked so beautiful and she said it was delicious! She also got some chips on the side which I sampled and loved. I also had a latte, and I normally don't have high expectations for restaurant coffee but this was very nice!Food comes out quickly and you can sit at the bar and watch the chefs cook in front of you! Service is nothing to write home about but that's about standard for London. Prices are reasonable for London but way too expensive for a real diner - but then the food here is fabulous and much more posh. You won't make a mistake by deciding to eat here.

Uap4ANf4jkIcqqpN1CcgIw.text: Recently I've been on this lets have brunch and check out American places in London. So with a Yelp friend, we both arranged to come here on a Sunday afternoon. The food was really good, I got the eggs benedict which was tasty and so well made. My friend got the huevos rancheros which I've never had before so she let me try it and it was nice but she said shes had better. As we were both still quite peckish, we both got ice cream - she got two scoops and I got one scoop, the ice-cream was really nice and creamy. I want to come back here and try the burgers now.

A8U1RInB26N6XPUMyJqvjA.text: I no longer live in Notting Hill, and it is for this reason that I can now honestly say this is my fav burger spot in the whole of London. A few months and a few miles to the southeast have me craving the single cheeseburger (double patties) with pickles, onions, sauce, and good ol' French's mustard way too often. And there's certainly nothing like it in SE1! Everything else from before still rings true. Also note: on weekdays, if you go before 11am for breakfast or before 7pm for dinner and get the loyalty card, the bill is half-priced. It's gotta be one of the better deals in West London!

3Yr7O1yye1HWA-1_pWauFg.text: We fortuitously stumbled across Electric Diner with some good friends while looking for brunch in the neighborhood and figured the bustling crowd there couldn't be too far wrong.  After a 30-minute wait during which we wandered further up Portobello Rd, they texted me back and seated us in a big comfy booth in the middle of the restaurant.  Brunch was awesome.  My wife said it was the best she's had in London, period.  Our Rwandan filter coffees were strong, full-flavored, and inexpensive at £2, my waffle was delicious with clotted cream and just a little too much strawberry preserves, and my wife's Eggs Benedict were perfectly made.  Our companions proclaimed their breakfasts to be similarly excellent.  And the side order of hashbrowns ordered for the table was huge, crispy, salty, and very good..  And to cap it off, the staff was friendly and laid back, the atmosphere was lively, and the space is interesting, kind of like a hipster fallout shelter but with better music.  We'll certainly be back.

xWSjojPsH3ZdSZfKjvSgog.text: Best Burger I ever had, anytime that I visit London it is a must stop. Great atmosphere, food is prepared right in front of you which ensures its quality and cleanliness.

FN8BjJCaIDsRMWpcFC2fdg.text: We were there for brunch and we weren't disappointed by the menu. My daughter had a green boost smoothie which was delicious. She ordered a favourite, eggs benedict, which she thought was particularly good. I was avoiding carbo so ordered a cheese and ham omelette. This was very disappointing and I should have spoken to them at the time for an explanation. It was very rubbery and the shape of it suggested it had been cooked in a mould. It felt very artificial, not the fresh, light and fluffy one I was expecting and hoping for. All our food came very quickly, almost too quickly.Having said all of that we would both go back - I'd just make a different choice. The staff were very friendly and helpful when we were trying to get our bearings for the tube.

-nOo6HC_YlItCpyi-OLBzQ.text: Always an excellent place for brunch. Good English breakfast and superb, thick cut bacon.

TC4BOrU0m6ILZtPIuVTExA.text: Swanky diner to get dinner after a movie at the Electric Cinema. It gets pretty busy but we were able to grab seats at the bar on a bustling Sunday evening.Selection of beer was awesome, great variety of both local and imported beer.However food was a bit disappointing.  17 quid Fried honey chicken was intense, and the sauce was a bit too cloying and thick.  9 quid burger was okay, nothing to write home about.  Fries were standard.  Perhaps it's better during brunch.

iwjPjxEPNWR_AkQkEcGdLg.text: Great eggs benedict and crumpets, wow! We went around 8:30 on a weekend morning and there wasn't a line, thankfully. The space is nice, the music is great, and the people who work there seemed like good friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Loved the heavy crumpets!
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict of amazingness.

g_MihQRL3z_cHRzO9TB-gQ.text: It's easy to find breakfast in London. To find an excellentbreakfast makes things a little more complicated, and to find an excellent breakfast at a reasonable price can be a real challenge. Throw in great service and a venue that says 'experience' rather than just a seat to plonk yourself down on, requires trawling through endless online reviews and in-depth analyses. Elegant yet simply prepared. Photos: Rosie HillsdonAll you have to do is head towards Portobello Road, West London, and find yourself sat in the gloriously comfortable leather booths of the Electric Diner. Providing a brilliant array of dishes that your taste buds seem to anticipate just from staring at the menu, the newly-opened Electric Diner combines the comforts of the traditional American diner with a French underground edge.The December winter morning was firmly left outside as we deliberated over our menu choices with our waiter. We were told that the plates were large and meant for sharing, so we chose avocado on toast with chilli and poached egg, and an open-faced ham, cheese fondue with fried egg. Recommended to us also came the thick peppered bacon and hash browns as side orders. Elegant yet simply prepared, all four of these dishes had a unique twist that perfectly reflected the eccentricity of the diner, not to mention that they were all absolutely delicious. The Croque Monsieur-esque ham and cheese fondue gets a special mention.A collaborative effort between Chicago-based chef Brendan Sodikoff and the Soho House Group, the Electric Diner caters for every customer, even if it is just for a cup of Darlington's coffee. The restaurant was buzzing by 10am, and the staff was efficient, unobtrusive and never missed the opportunity to refill your glass.Though at the higher end of reasonably-priced, there is no doubt that the creatively cooked fresh products, served with friendly professionalism, was well worth it. A second visit is definitely on the cards to try their 'All Day Menu' served after 12pm, and a little later to try the wonderfully-named cocktail 'Chasing Maria'.Rosie HillsdonFood: 18/20Drinks: 16/20Service: 19/20The Electric Diner: 53/60Electric Diner, 191 Portobello Road London W11 2ED is open from 8am for 'Breakfast', 12pm onwards for the 'All Day Menu', and is open until 1am at the weekend. No reservations.(*Written on behalf of The Upcoming magazine - theupcoming.co.uk/2012/1…)

0jLsA16u67LYx1pbUIphOA.text: As locals to portobello road it is rare for us to find a place were we are treated as such. I LOVE this place. Great food, relaxed vibe, creative environment and staff that really care.

NJ5p9fSCemu76D29aohfmw.text: Had a lovely time here. The staff were really friendly, nicely decorated, great washrooms and good food. I had the squash soup and bibb avocado salad. Both were yummy and I would get again. Their Bloody Mary is a must have!

cF26KhP4eo9B6JnjMY27jg.text: I'm a big fan of the Electric Cinema, so perhaps it's no surprise I also love the Electric Diner. Their food is consistently good and they offer a ton of crowd-pleasing options (think burgers, mac & cheese, ribs, lobster roll, honey-fried chicken). I'm also into the quinoa salad which is a healthier but very tasty option. Smashed potatoes loaded with garlic and butter-y goodness is clearly a no-brainer. The chocolate cream pie dessert option is also top-notch.Love their drinks as well, and would always recommend stopping in for a drink on a Saturday night. The bar is fun and generally pretty busy.

Q-i7_dOj9rqWWf20F__T1w.text: My girlfriend heard about this cool, hipster restaurant.  We intended to go for breakfast but when we saw pics on yelp and the menu we decided to wait 30 mins and sip on a couple of delicious Bloody Mary's to wait for their lunch menu to begin!  haha We shared the chicken wings - which was ok, not really what we expected.  But the  burger & fries were delicious.  The bloody mary was so good!  And we were stuffed but we still shared a dessert which was good.  Can't recall the name but it was a pastry with whip cream and strawberries I believe...light but good.

Cwa_3R0DRYR8D-IQoLhd-Q.text: Sloped in here after watching a film upstairs with SWMBO. We sat at the busy bar, glugged beer and cocktails and then took a seat for dinner overlooking the kitchen.  Atmosphere was belting, really enjoyed the varied music, and all the staff are working their socks off.  The menu is kind of simple and very reasonably priced.  Food was delicious.  Flat iron chicken was juicy, burger was a very tasty burger with finely judged bun, cheese and patty (!), and the fries and the pickles were champion.  Too stuffed for dessert.  No reservations - put your name down around when you want to eat and they'll call you in due course.  The bar gets rammed.  You can let the staff take your coat if there's nowhere to put it.  Also, saw 3 to 10 year old kids there at 7pm and later... so no problem if you are with-child, it seems, and they all looked happy enough

b2-dMXFeNUCQpwJuWRflfg.text: i ordered a beer, paid and was givin my change in 50ps....ordered another beer with spare ribs,decided i wanted it to take away, he said "no i couldn't , too late". Spare ribs should be called spare rib, just 1 on the plate with 3 marble sized crusty bits on the side...Paid again and got more 50ps in change, obviously this is a way to try and make me tip even with their crazy 12.5 service charge that was already charged....walked out with 8 pound in 50ps...What a joke of a place...Never again.

y3F7m5hus7vfRoRyVRIVRA.text: Best place in nothing hill to have brunch If you are around don't doubt to come here,this place serves great food Id say best eggs Benedict i had in london errr apart from the ones i had in duck and waffle, really tasty! Place can get really busy during weekends bruch time, make sure you book in advance, waiting for a table while hungry and hungover is not fun :)

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Delicious Egg Benedict@electric diner
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Delicious scramble eggs and salmon@electric diner

znuzbYzGmfgIh9s4nrOsVg.text: Great prices, service and decor. Had the Full English which had pork belly instead of bacon - real plus.Tried the smoked salmon and eggs too - good portion size.

of9noNqW1vr2K64eMQFCqQ.text: This place just oozes cool from the walls. Possibly the best restaurant offering on Portobello. Considering the location, it isn't ridiculously expensive and you will be satiated by the time you leave. I still dream about that cheeseburger. Light and fluffy brioche bread with gooey meat party infused with the cheese. Worth the train back to London just for another one. The waitress was nice to us. Took the time for small talk even though the place was packed. Much appreciated. Good ales available. A must.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Theyre pretty serious with that knife. Awesome brioche bread though.

Xsb6S-IPdpOURxqvQoqGsg.text: No bad. Stopped here while walking up and down portobello road. Fresh produce, very nice.

VqedCBX2LhxOfWysxRMdZQ.text: This is a great restaurant with excellent food and great service. The flat-top chicken dish is great as is the salad with smoked fish. Hard to imagine anything not being good.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Great salad with smoked fish, chicken in the background!

lXwVAwGt3oUJnuGmr68agg.text: Electric diner.........it is one of the most solid overlap choices there is... it exists in the space between eating a falafel on the portobello road sidewalk and drinking mimosas with raspberries on the rim of your champagne glass on primrose hill.  it's nice and clean but not posh... it's got quality food but not too fancy.... friendly host / hostess and bartenders. Slight issue with the attire for waiters / waitresses-- i'm pretty sure the only requirement is black shirt so we are often asking other patrons black shirts for our check in vain.

edlgHE2IRBKIwwW_z75FBQ.text: Great food.  Big portions. Great service. Really energetic staff that bring a good vib to the place.  Server was so excited about the specials and how interesting they were that I hated not to order them. But the other items sounded so good and they catered to my gluten free needs.

vPKol0ORCru_b7ODM2obMg.text: Friendly service; otherwise highly overrated/ priced. We had a main here last night and although the staff was very friendly, I wouldn't really take the effort to come back again. The food was very salty and quite expensive even by london standards for the value you get. Nothing out of the ordinary at least. Our (white) wine was lukewarm to start with and chilled towards the end.

WBxI9oB_oarB0qB_AZtNMA.text: This place would have been 5 stars, if it weren't for the moodiness of a number of the male staff. Typical, fun American decor inside - however the menu choice was rather limited (and pricey). The cocktails were second to none and food was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom

PB35BmQ1Km1F8tyOKxUWLA.text: I'd been meaning to come here for ages (pretty shocking as I've lived in London my whole life). We came in for a late breakfast and sat at the bar in front of the cooking station. We saw lots of delicious looking plates come past us while we were waiting for ours. I was certainly not disappointed with my scrambled eggs and smoked salmon. Huge portion of really tasty smoked salmon (I find smoked salmon hit and miss as it can sometimes be a bit tough or stringy). The eggs were very light and fluffy and also plentiful. Service was relatively quick but not super friendly. It wouldn't stop me returning. Next time I'd rather sit in a booth as the bar is a bit cramped and there's nowhere to put your bag if you have one.

Zv9M5ZyQzhKUsjvt7iR7VQ.text: Food and ambience was great but management is shady. We went in for snacks before a movie and wanted to take advantage of their 50% discount from 5-6pm. When we got our check, they said we were seated at 4.58pm so they didn't want to give us the discount. That's pretty bad form ...

JltEaRg41Eti1Jy4RLlVgw.text: While the Soho House group can do no real wrong in my eyes - I always find that my expectations of Electric Diner are higher than they should be.  The various times we have visited in the past year or so, it seems like the menu has not changed at all. If it has, it's been a very subtle, un-noticeable one. My usual order was the flat iron chicken, but the last time or so I'd ordered it the sauce was watery and it was overpowered with garlic, leaving little else taste.   They use to do the most incredible lemon meringue pie too, but it seems that came off the menu pretty quickly - which is unfortunate, as the door stop sized slice you were given was not only incredibly delicious but also great value for money.   The decor of course, it lovely, great leather bound booth seating with dim atmospheric lighting even during the day. The bar is a great place to sit and people watch everyone shopping on Portobello road too. Which I feel is the one saving grace to this place.   Stop for a drink or three, maybe avoid the food.

J8c0elkxIEzb06OSl1du4A.text: Just arrived in London after a twelve year hiatus.  Told by a local chef to check out the Diner.  Amazing place, great food, Awesome staff..ask for Simone if you are traveling with a martini snob.

oyxu-b8o-65hJPmDPh4oKg.text: Cool vibe, had drinks at the bar on my last night in London as I was recommended it by a few friends.Had only American beers and the bartender is quite friendly.

XP556pseWhU88N_57Z0rWA.text: This is such a unique diner in London. Right alone Portobelo road. The way they operate I found was very neat! I got the English breakfast and the eggs Royale with orange juice. Brilliant service! Sat at the bar area in front of the chefs. No complaints whatsoever! A bit of a touristy area but great, great food! Well done, Electric!

EEahkLVxXRKJ4OLZ9FZnxg.text: First off, let's get one thing out of the way... I LOVE BRUNCH!!Honestly, this had to have been one of the best meals I've had in London, and the fact that it was brunch and I was drinking made it all the more better. A classmate of mine invited me out to brunch and decided to take me here since I've never been to Notting Hill before. Located right next to the Electric Cinema is this place, and renamed it Electric Diner. Apparently, there was a fire and they had to close for a while but are now reopened. Funny story about that to follow...So, we started off with drinks. My friend ordered the Bloody Mary and I ordered the Horse's Back since I don't like Bloody Mary's. When the BM arrived at the table, I was like "DAMNNNNNNNN!" That drink was so beautiful... artfully crafted to perfection, and garnished with a bazillion pickles on top. Of course I tried it, and I thought it was really good. Never liked a BM until this one, true story. My Horse's Back wasn't bad, super strong and had a kick to it, especially being the first thing that entered my stomach for the day.As for the food, I was really impressed with my dish, simply called open-faced ham, cheese fondue, and fried egg. I gobbled it all up because it was so amazing. My friend ordered the ham steak and green eggs which also looked good. Seriously, I'm coming back here for brunch, it's SOOOO GOOD!So, during our meal the fire alarm kept going off. Sort of getting in the way of our lovely meal, but it wasn't really that big of a deal. Eventually, management came over and apologized and politely kicked us out because they had to do an inspection. Oh, but what else? They told us the meal was taken care of. A FREEEEEE MEAL?!!! Hell yeah! Score! Touchdown! Victory danceeeee, babyyyyy. YUP. We were TWO happy brunchers. And yup, we'll be back for more soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Granola and Banana Yogurt
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benny
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Check out this brunch spread

bu-hTYeoT1uQyBVUQXWq1g.text: Popped in here before I went to the cinema next door and I was impressed how stylish it was inside. The staff were really friendly and I had a beer sitting at the bar as I also noticed people walking by at the open seating by the window. I will definitely come back for food which looked great.

LOkf0-SJoQJSUZxWpGMaWA.text: Had a great experience here! After walking in from the rain we were immediately seated at a booth in the back. The restaurant is decorated in 50's shabby chic and it really set a fun, but cool mood to the place.The waitress was very nice and patient. Some of our group wanted to make changes to the standard menu items and she was only happy to comply. I had the quinoa salad, which had grapes and feta and almonds. It sounded like a weird combo on the menu, but it tasted really light and refreshing. I stole a bite of a burger and it was delicious! Very moist and the cheese was not over powering. It was also nice to see a bun hold together. Stuffed to the max, we decided to throw caution to the wind and got the chocolate pie. It was a very rich chocolate tart with an oreo cookie base. The portion was huge and we just about managed to finish it between two of us. The service, food, and ambiance were great and I can't wait to come back and try some more of their food options!!!

48uB_VmIMCO6mOVS4_9kYQ.text: So our 1 night in London was a rough start, but we decided to check out the electric Diner, our host recommend and I fell in love. This is a charming old little restaurant makes you feel as if you've stepped back into time. The staff were so friendly and very helpful, the food was delicious- the best Eggs Benedict I've ever had or made, the coffee was rich with flavor and gave me the extra energy I needed to get to the airport. Thank you for a wonderful experience, if I'm ever back in Notting Hill I will be back!

ox8KcX0mLNiLDbElHlYueA.text: This place has a really nice aesthetic & you get 50% off your dinner if you catch a movie next door! The food: I ordered the flat-iron chicken, hash browns & broccoli. My friend ordered the salmon fillet & mash. Let's just say, they should've let the chicken on just a tad bit longer, but the flavor of the au jus was very good. The hashbrowns were fried a nice golden brown & the broccoli was well, broccoli (I find it very hard to eat veggies in Europe). My friend's salmon smelled fishy, but she seemed pleased & scarfed down her mashed potatoes like her life depended on it. So overall, the food was good but I don't believe the price was very fair. £17 for JUST flat-iron chicken?! I digress. . . The service: We were greeted as soon as we walked in were told to sit wherever we like. Our waitstaff were very attentive and answered our questions well. They didn't check up on us much, but I much prefer that so that we can enjoy our meal without the awkward smile when they ask if it was ok. They did ask if were were pleased afterwards though which I appreciated. All-in-all this place scores average in my eyes, but I really liked the people so 4 stars it is!

Lm-WV34hLNYO8ivnYUNULA.text: Chic diner in the heart of Portobello Road! It is next door to their Electric Movie theater. I happened to take a look at their menu, as I did with the other restaurants near by, to observe what type of food they had (and compared prices). They had a Michelin plaque on the outside wall, underneath the menu, which caught my attention. The food menu seemed very similar to that of American breakfast back in California.The prices were very fair, and was a little more on the affordable side compared to nearby restaurants.Now for the food:Holy $H!T!!! The mashed potatoes were the BEST I have ever had in my LIFE! I had the chicken and waffles (also ordered the thick cut bacon on the side - I would have been much more happier with the mashed potatoes as my added side order). The chicken was really crunchy crisp, and flaky. They use dark meat, and had a huge flavor spectrum on that plate.We also ordered the flat-iron chicken (added a side of mashed potatoes - a must!) it was amazing! The Au jus that came with is was so amazing! This entire meal was just very nostalgic to my childhood flavors, but on crack (because it was more amazing!). We had leftovers, and I was extremely happy to have had a couple bites of the mashed potato in the morning because f!!! It was still so f!!!!!!!! Good!

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Open kitchen! Michelin award in 2018?! Good bye me

xRZBuN5uuzEZpJ0Va1kKhw.text: We were staying in Lancaster gate and having not had a good breakfast in over a week traveling around, we really wanted a delicious spot to start our day. Electric Diner did not disappoint! We came in contact with several staff members who seem to all work together to make the experience lovely. The coffee was tasty and came out pretty and quickly. We ended up sharing the eggs Benedict, French toast and hash browns. Although too much food, everything was so delicious we couldn't stop eating. I'd say this was one of the best meals I'd had in Europe over a 10 day period, we'd definitely be back next time we're in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom

hOT1nFoveTf0-G0-9X3_xw.text: I was excited to try this diner as I was craving American food and read great reviews. My friend arrived early to get us a table and so by the time I arrived it should have been a ten minute wait. Instead it was 30 minutes plus!We saw others get seated at the window, bar and a big table that was reserved. Finally we got the table and waited another ten minutes to take our order. The waiter saw us but was apparently slammed with other tables.Once we ordered we had to ask twice for tap water. At long last our food arrived and my single cheeseburger was actually a double. I was too hungry to send it back and decided to chow down!Food was decent. Nothing special about my burger with just cheese and pickles. No lettuce or tomato and anything else would have cost extra. Fries were good and plenty. My friend was also hungry to eat her vegetarian breakfast, a hearty meal although a steep price.I don't feel the burger was worth £14 without fries. The shake was good but also not £7 worth. Ridiculous prices for a tourist location with terrible service. There are far better diners and burgers in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Double Cheeseburger with fries

a9yLOTAr1S8LQdcVhtz_Tg.text: This place was so cool- one of the best pisco sours I've ever had. Go for the cocktails but stay for the comfy booths and dark sexy vibe, while eating super original food. My friend wanted breakfast at 10:30pm, and on their all day menu they serve avocado toast and poached eggs with chili flakes, but I was able to get a MASSIVE plate of okonomiyaki. We also split some guacamole and taro chips and a large bowl of homemade bread and butter pickle chips. Service was slow but who cares!

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom

yvYn8OGQzvd_1Dt7MJ27LA.text: (delayed review) Went to London for thanksgiving and was so delighted to find the electric diner to celebrate at! The standard thanksgiving menu they had was everything I could have wanted and more. And gave ya the perfect reason to explore the notting hill neighborhood. A very fun atmosphere,connected to an old movie theatre. They allowed us to make a reservation and the staff was friendly and accommodating to us Americans who were celebrating abroad. Their standard menu looked delicious and I'd like to go back if I ever return to London!

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Thanksgiving spread at Electric Diner.

1H-_S87LDgw6QlCCuzXetw.text: Delicious food prepared by staff that really cares.  If you want to watch them make it you can sit at the counter.  It's Notting Hill prices, but not exorbitantly so.  Not sure if they take bookings but your best bet is to get here before or after the lunch rush to make sure you're not left waiting.  Michelin-listed, I think.

atLp-jGEHe0x7Ay3qo8i3A.text: Below beloved Electric Cinema is this trendy little restaurant. I've popped by here twice on two different Notting Hill days, and I've enjoyed my cocktails and deviled eggs both times. I know tequila cocktails and hardboiled eggs might not be for everyone, but they're for me. Blessed be, my specific tastes are on trend. Their full meal menu also looks fab, but I haven't strayed. Pull up to the window or sit right out front and watch the people go by. Lovely loos, too.

uKzr_GiwCQ_TxHfrXa8vqg.text: Terrific English breakfast, wonderfully crispy hash browns, and a delectable smoked salmon! The diner has a great old school underground feel. Attractive staff  and attentive service.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Another shot of the Full English breakfast and side smoked salmon
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. You must try the crispy hash browns!!
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast, crispy hash browns, smoked salmon, breakfast tea, and house press watermelon.

cjGZajMuQoZvSEzpBvBEsQ.text: We went a week ago and looks good but today's staff performance was really bad, no only in manners but in caring the customers experience

2UOyQh_F7tHW54UxlP9Xew.text: I had the full English. My wife had the veg breakfast. Both were excellent and arrived quickly. Our flat whites were well prepared and the right temp. Lastly, the service was terrific even though they got slammed because a good rain storm popped up.

foWvzUGCu_3_9TmgyQQzwA.text: Best Burger I've had in London!!! I added avocado, egg and bacon to it and the taste was unbelievable, fries were great as well

bEYhSVIAQYQAWxftywgadg.text: Yum.  The bacon is ridiculous, & the Rueben is quite impressive.  Beautiful New York aesthetic

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom

0R8eiPmjAzk5z0F8hVeiIw.text: I overestimated the time it would take to get from Point A to Point B & arrived a full 25 minutes early for our showtime at Electric Cinema. We spent those extra moments indulging in French onion soup & Fries Au Cheval at Electric Diner's bar. Satisfyingly rich & fatty comestibles. Love the idea of fries accompanied by mornay, an egg, & aioli. 3.75 stars for food. Electric Diner is a happening place! Speak loudly to get your order across & enjoy the chaotic, but organized dance of the cooks behind the bar if you're seated there. This busy energy unfortunately translated into some confusion in their service. There was a lag in all things from ordering to getting the bill. We asked for to-go containers & my fries were placed in a container not suitable for takeout. Meh, would consider returning knowing i'd have to carve out more than a half an hour for a meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Onion soup
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom

3gyf3g8_0w7XUPbyrFevnA.text: YES!!!!!!!!! We were in the area to hit up the antique market on a Saturday and wanted to get breakfast nearby. Easily the best Full English I had while I was in town. Perfectly poached eggs, sausage, black pudding, and beans were on point. The toast was super thick and served with butter, strawberry jelly and jam. That bacon though, probably the best bacon I have shoved down my gullet. Thick with a nice smoky flavor. I will think about this meal for years to come. Great location if you plan to do some shopping on Portobello Road. We were able to catch two seats along their front window facing the street. We just sat and watched all the comings and goings of the market while enjoying our amazing breakfast. I highly recommend the ED for breakfast and we plan to return when we are in town again.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Nice window seats
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Tea Service
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast  13.00. Amazing meal! Best breakfast I had while in London, highly recommend!

1Bv3wS3lGCJgmborlFn2jQ.text: This is a proper diner!Really cool vibe and the food was ok good quality but lacking a little bit of punch.My friend had the burger and I had the tartare.Im from Belgium so I had my fair share of tartare (or American as we call it), this one of our national dishes so I an a little bit picky. The meat was tasty but it was lacking some punch perhaps becaus there was no onions or shallots which usually take part in the tartare as I know it but I will forgive them as overall it was still good!

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Tartare and fries, the best combo

RrA02R1Jxiur78yZafbCyQ.text: This place is very good. Small menu but that's a good thing not a bad. The honey fried chicken was so so good.I'll be back for round 2 this week!

bx-GuWLgyAZ0X46f2qSCAw.text: This is a fun place with good food, and perfect for anyone who likes Americana, but the atmosphere/decor is the reason to come, and if you book a table for two they may seat you (as they did with us) right at the back, next to the loos and behind a pillar which blocks your view of the restaurant and completely ruins the point of being there.This was a birthday treat so I asked to move, but they said the better tables are reserved for groups of three plus.In short, come here if you're in a group and likely to get a table with a view - avoid if you're in a two.

2CdJS4f1VBJJs2_7N2XjSw.text: Delicious!! This is not your typical British fare. I had the fried chicken. It was extremely rich and good! It was loaded with honey and ginger. I don't love uber sweet foods, and they did this just right. My friend had a double cheeseburger along with the fries au chavel. It was a large portion of fries with a mild creamy sauce, garlic aioli to dip them in, topped with a fried egg. They were pretty good! We also ordered a side of roasted broccoli (in butter) to be healthy...For drinks, the Root to Mule (Moscow Mule with gin) was awesome! GET THE CHOCOLATE & WHISKEY POT A' LA CREMA for dessert!The vibe is awesome! The service is great and the music was perfect. I highly recommend eating here! Check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Diner Bloody Mary
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate & whiskey pot a' la crema
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Fries AI cheval

p05vtvzrDvfs85Yv7KO54g.text: What a fun place in Notting Hill for the last night of my trip. When we walked in the door they had an old track on the wall playing old school tunes, PSB in particular. Sold.Totally relaxed vibe with friendly service.I tried the pea and mint soup which was warm, savory and delicious. I next had the crab gnocchi which had a chunky tomato sauce that was really yummy and not heavy like gnocchi can often be. For dessert the incredible lemon meringue pie is great for sharing. I also had a bite of a yummy rhubarb cheesecake.Oh wait, a ate a few perfectly crunchy French fries too!

photos.caption: Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Massive lemon meringue pie. Get this.
Photo of Electric Diner - London, United Kingdom. Rhubarb cheesecake
